programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones endure disappointment at an auction, but hope a container they have secured at another site will make their day worthwhile.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Storage auction enthusiasts in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, are not pleased when Allen Haff and Ton Jones arrive in town searching for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The team visits an auction in Irving, where Victor buys a secret agent's locker and Bubba tries to sell some explicit art.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a cigarette machine into a device for holding bike tools, and Tyler plans to buy a rare 1950s pedal-powered bulldozer.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew upgrades an electric car from the 1960s, and Rick is invited to throw the first pitch at a baseball game.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A huge storm throws the hunting season into jeopardy. Joe and Tommy venture out nonetheless, but as the lightning closes in, they find themselves trapped in choppy waters.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Three ladies who pooled their money at auction go on a date with the Turtleman, where he meets them at a pond full of snapping turtles.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ponderosa speedway is taken over by vermin and the Turtle Team manages to catch raccoons, groundhogs and possums. Plus, Turtleman tracks down an escaped boa constrictor.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A banner from the secret WWII airborne division The Flying Tigers flies into the shop. Plus, Chum gets his hands on a 1980s Ooze-it toy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A suit worn by the Godfather of Soul, James Brown, dances its way into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Considering whether ancient rulers had otherworldly links. Experts examine whether history's most powerful leaders were 'chosen' and guided by aliens.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar One which suggest that cover-ups and conspiracy theories have concealed the secrets for decades. As well as delving into cases where UFOs have chased commercial flights, the series tries to understand what the US government might be hiding from its people.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders have a mysterious new rival at an auction in the historical town of DeSoto, where a collection of Willie Nelson memorabilia is up for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor manages to turn Bubba against Ricky at an auction in a wealthy suburb of Dallas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War drum is brought into the shop, as well as an 1834 book with the original rules of baseball, and a customer brings in a 1970s skateboard.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets a visit from The Boss when a Bruce Springsteen tour jacket rocks into the store. Meanwhile, Corey checks out some motorcycle art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A Miami auction presents Ton Jones and Allen Haff with a big score, including a Delta Relay Rocket and a camouflage hovercraft, but they struggle to make a good profit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chicago, where they find a 1984 Yamaha snowmobile, a rare autographed baseball glove and a 1950s Robby the Robot toy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit a country town with a thriving art scene, and Victor competes to buy an antique train set.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Carrollton, where the lots up for auction include hunting gear and glass-blowing equipment.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look ah how pilots attempted to save 509 passengers when a tail fin blew off a Boeing 747 minutes after take-off from an airport in Tokyo.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Texas has been a hotbed for extraordinary UFO activity for decades. As Hangar 1 digs into some of the Lone Star State's most unusual and best-known cases, patterns point to Texas's unique role in a larger government conspiracy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate reports of bird-like figures that practised advanced medical science in ancient times, considering whether or not they could have been extra-terrestrial.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a coffin inside a storage unit in Chicago and hope it does not contain any unpleasant surprises. They also find a collection of toxic grenades.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders take on wealthy opponents at an Ontario auction, where they find a remote-controlled model of a Viper FanJet aircraft and a 1920s field camera.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy hires bodyguards to keep order at an auction, and Paul tries to stop Bogart from quitting.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Patrick Pecker fills in for Don at the auction in Western Road, and Cindy tries to take advantage of the change.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon are joined by Josh Widdicombe and Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock to play Defender, Love You To Bits and Football Manager 2017.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Phil Wang makes sure his outstanding outfit leaves even less to the imagination than it did before and Jessica Knappett demonstrates her mastery of a child's percussion instrument.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Radio 4's The News Quiz host Miles Jupp and journalist Quentin Letts joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Sandi Toksvig, John Lloyd, Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies for the quiz with a difference. The host asks the teams to consider hypothetical questions, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim have two wheelie bins full of junk and just three days to create a spectacular moment with a pro athlete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick Helm enjoys a romantic, culinary getaway to Paris with comedian David Trent in tow. The odd couple savour oysters and champagne.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nish Kumar joins Nick in London for a Brexit-defying continental feast! The pair enjoy Italian, Portuguese and Polish food on their jaunt round the capital.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When Frank goes nuts for a century-old snack icon, he must decide if it is worth an unprecedented sum of money to take it home.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori Bernier discover more potential bargains in storage lockers, including a trio of motorhomes, bronze statues and jet skis.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse starts a bidding war on a unit without knowing what is inside, while a flock of birds keeps the auction-goers interested.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: At an old school drive-in, Mike and Danielle uncover a vintage reel of Beatles' footage that could be the only one of its kind.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys meet a former arms dealer and her judo champion husband, and make a killer back-room deal.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat builds a dream home for a lottery winner and Peter goes to any lengths to deliver on two entryways for Canada's Winter Games.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi rebuilds the force's beat car. Meanwhile, an old patrol car turns up in the Czech Republic.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier and his two teams of car buffs build scrap cars to try in a bid to out-brake Shane Lynch's Jaguar F-Type SVR. Can their imagination and never-say-die attitude overcome millions of pounds of automotive design?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert is at the centre of some satsuma-based controversy and Phil Wang finds his Bruce Lee costume offers an unexpected advantage.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Alex Brooker, journalist Jeremy Paxman and actress Sally Phillips to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include positive thinking, tourist attractions and former prime minister David Cameron.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with comedian Sara Pascoe and former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Bill Bailey, Eddie Izzard, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the host asks questions on the topic of house and home, and awards points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Lucy goes on a wild night out in London with TV personality Alan Carr, while back in Hebden Bridge, Jon spends the night with his best friend, Matt Forde.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Jeremy Clarkson, David Mitchell and Ross Noble, and regular panellist Alan Davies, on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topics of health and safety, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts the comedy quiz, welcoming guests Greg Davies, Simon Evans and Micky Flanagan, who join him to offer opinions on world events in an edition from 2011. With Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: The fall of Jericho, in which Joshua and his men lay siege on the fortified city for seven days. Then they blew their trumpets and its walls came crashing down. The Israelites razed the city, killing every man, woman and child. It's a fantastic Biblical tale of victory through faith, but is there any truth behind the story?.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: According to legend the Holy Grail is a dish or cup with special powers, able to provide happiness, eternal youth and food in infinite abundance. This programme catches up with a man who believes he has solved the mystery of the Holy Grail, one of the most famous lost religious relics of all time.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The First Raid of the Vikings
programme.desc: Experts analyse the content of Viking burial sites to learn more about Norse culture, beginning with the mass grave of a raiding party, which dates back to Roman times.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates conflicting accounts of the killing of Italian dictator Benito Mussolini in 1945.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The decade of propaganda, impassioned speeches, newspaper articles, posters and campaigning that all led to one moment - Hitler being made Chancellor of Germany in January 1933.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The Time Team document the restoration of Dover Castle, a project which aimed to restore the main rooms of the castle back to their original appearance..

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Not fully convinced the man is innocent, Boyd tries to find the rest of the family to establish the truth, but when he does eventually track the relatives down, he realises they have a lot to hide. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. Unfortunately, despite his best efforts, the case has a tragic ending. Scott manipulates Honey into setting a date for their wedding, and Gina tells Smithy she's suffering from cancer, while Gary makes himself unpopular by criticising the boys in uniform.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to a suspected arson attack on a run-down council estate. Later, a young boy is found handcuffed to a bench by a river.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. Unfortunately, despite his best efforts, the case has a tragic ending. Scott manipulates Honey into setting a date for their wedding, and Gina tells Smithy she's suffering from cancer, while Gary makes himself unpopular by criticising the boys in uniform.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mubbs allows Dean to treat a patient unsupervised so he can spend time alone with new locum Denise. However, when disastrous complications develop, they both find their careers on the line. Mickie tries to prove the family planning unit is a worthwhile endeavour, but does not approve of Donna's methods, Jess gets her exam results and tension brews between Ric and Lola. Mina Anwar guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A woman learns her father may be responsible for her son's death, while Mark takes an interest in the case of an attractive female patient.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: JT unwittingly puts a woman's life in jeopardy by sending her to the house of serial rapist Alan Kennedy, forcing Samantha and Terry to abandon a covert surveillance operation and rush to her rescue. Reg and Tony arrest two squabbling burglars and Smithy urges Gina to give up smoking, while Ramani is astounded to overhear Margaret and Roger discussing her love life - or lack of one.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is concerned about the state of Sam's marriage, Arthur spots some football talent at Walford town, and the trial of Nick Cotton reaches a climax.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Fowlers get a new lodger, Pete gets a pleasant surprise, and Dot makes a sad decision.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy steps in when tensions run high between Pearce and Bayleaf. Sicknote is still attracting unwanted attention. The crew is called to a dangerous situation in a coldstore.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: An American arrives in town claiming to be the rightful Laird of Glenbogle, and demands the right to prove himself in an ancient clan ritual. Meanwhile, Katrina returns without Fergal and the way seems clear for Archie, but she may have a battle on her hands as Lexie prepares to fight for the love of her life.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim cuts short a holiday in France to guard a VIP threatened with assassination - but it turns out the dignitary does not want protection. Drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The recovery of a stolen piano causes conflict in the Boswell house and Freddie announces that he has sold his flat to help Joey out of debt.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Jeffrey resolves to sort out his marital difficulties by agreeing to a divorce. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith's former boyfriend Alistair rocks the boat by asking Sandy for a date, and Jean is given cause to feel jealous of Lionel. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Howard Cross the Atlantic Single-Handed?
programme.desc: Hobbo is convinced Nelly is his natural mother and tries to establish where he was born, while Howard vows to row across the Atlantic single-handed in a bid to counter Marina's suggestions that he lacks spontaneity. Barry's clothing problem is solved when he is called to help clear Toby's blocked drain.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lynleys are looking forward to becoming parents, but Helen succumbs to temptation and dabbles in her husband's latest case. However, her past involvement with the victim unwittingly puts her in the firing line, with devastating consequences for everyone. Jemma Redgrave and Barbara Flynn guest star, with Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Lesley Vickerage.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates an arson attack on a 1980s music station that resulted in the death of a controversial DJ, and looks into the subsequent suicide of the station's owner. Strickland seeks a permanent replacement for the absent Halford, but Pullman and Standing call his bluff.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a children's home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. When an artist's impression of a skeleton found in an archaeological dig matches one of the youngsters, the team tries to determine the identity of the paedophile. Starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A London couple get rid of walls to create an open-plan space that they hope will add value, a Cornish bathroom scrubs up with amazing results and a father splashes out on a bedroom extension for his daughter. Interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and appraises the end results.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the third day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle Race, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone who gets caught in the first round is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Green Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel is forced to reveal all to Jai, Malone exerts his authority over Cain, and Mandy and Dan decide to go on a date together.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Samson finds a way to fund his trip, Laurel fights for her relationship with Jai, and Jamie is rattled by Andrea's custody intentions.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: A healthy gut can do more than help digestion. It is being linked to everything from obesity levels to mental health. Five years ago actress Catherine Tyldesley made a film for Tonight about diets. Now she is back to find out exactly what people need to know about keeping the digestive system in good working order.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Network Rail, which operates the country's railway tracks, focusing on Birmingham New Street station. Engineers battle the elements after extensive flooding, while beleaguered staff deal with stranded passengers demanding answers. Graffiti artist Banksy leaves Birmingham rail engineers a gift spray-painted on to one of the walls - all done under his usual veil of secrecy - and train manager Adam is faced with a passenger without a ticket.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Indian Pacific: Kalgoorlie to Sydney 'What Makes an Australian?'
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Feeling the full force of DI Renton's investigation, Laura looks to those closest to her for support, but when suspicions fall on Ian, she is left questioning who she can trust. Seeking answers, she turns to a former ally, but the information she gleans only fuels her concerns. Meanwhile in the past, Oliver brings Andrew some devastating news, leading him to make a reckless and dangerous excursion. Jack and Harry Williams's thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Katherine Kelly and Sam Spruell.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How modern-day objects are created. This time, how islanders of the Outer Hebrides use pedal power to weave Harris tweed, and how fermented shark is prepared.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is ecstatic when he snaps up a cult VW Corrado coupe with only one previous owner for a bargain price - but with cheap cars come expensive surprises.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Teutul Sr asks JQ and Jason Phol to build a tribute bike for the Sikorsky Aircraft Corp, but fabrication issues cause problems.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dennis longs for the orange 1970 Shelby GT500 that once beat him a drag race, but finds it has been almost ruined by salt corrosion. Meanwhile, getting a rare 1970 Chrysler 300 Hurst into shape proves to be a challenge for Dan.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Ohio to check on the Common Tern population, and plugs an abandoned mine shaft in northern California.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, with a closer look at how absinthe, belt buckles and gut strings are manufactured.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Rubber Gloves/Soap Carvings/Aircraft Cabinets/Motorcycle Brake Locks
programme.desc: The manufacture of objects such as rubber gloves and aircraft cabinets, and how processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring how South Africa's famous redbush tea is produced, how luggage is loaded onto the correct aeroplanes, and how a hairbrush fit for royalty is made.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: American rarities found by Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', featuring items from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A heavy storm causes 20ft-high waves, so most of the fleet heads for home. However, one boat sends out a mayday call, and the coastguard races to save the vessel.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Darrell Miklos attempts to decode and follow a 'treasure map' created by his boyhood idol, former NASA astronaut Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China is stunned when Mike Brewer shows him his latest purchase, an unroadworthy VW Beetle, and decides to turn it into a beach buggy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The beach buggy project is completed and Edd China takes it for a test drive before Mike Brewer tries to sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini follows up leads on a Woody, a Lotus Elite and a Roadster.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tries to make some money from a 1967 Dodge Power Wagon, and a two-cylinder Renault is auctioned.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: American rarities found by Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', featuring items from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: A train struggles to reach the highest point on the railroad north to make a crucial delivery, while off the grid, things get steamy as JT and Marvin build a traditional bath.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: One of the boats is lost in the typhoon, but as the weather clears, the crews must move on from the tragedy and return to work as quickly as possible.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily heads out with her new crew, while Hank and Shawn become embroiled in a race to reach a contested claim site.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the island's biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is ecstatic when he snaps up a cult VW Corrado coupe with only one previous owner for a bargain price - but with cheap cars come expensive surprises.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Memorable moments featuring items that brought in major sums of cash or turned out to be near-worthless.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hopes to strike a deal on a visit to a 900-year-old abbey in Somerset, before he takes a trip down memory lane at a pedal museum in East Sussex.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead try to arouse the passion of the Saab enthusiast community by restoring a rusty, non-driving 1973 Saab 96 to its past glory.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Sean asks Dan to find a 1969 Camaro that can be built into the custom resto-mod of his dreams. Plus, Jeff wants to give his 1969 Cutlass a rare Hurst makeover.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How deliveries are made to the International Space Station, and the processes used to make the world's most expensive and luxurious beds.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make a bicycle which can fold up to a tenth the size of a regular bike. Plus, the process behind the making of a Borsalino hat worn by Indiana Jones.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm Not the Size of a Hanger!
programme.desc: A bride prepares for a beer-themed wedding, while a customer seeks the help of her friends in choosing a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The wedding guru herself, Martha Stewart, visits Kleinfeld, hoping to help bride Bailey choose her perfect dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown, set against the backdrop of the city's iconic beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a Fijian dog whose nose was cut off in a hunting accident, bringing the unfortunate pooch back to Australia for major reconstructive surgery.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A look at daily life in New York's Bronx Zoo, documenting the routine operations that provide quality care for animals while educating the public on wildlife and conservation.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants 10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 27-year-old Tracy Ocasio, who went missing from West Orlando, Florida, in May 2009. On the night of her disappearance she was seen in the company of a man currently serving a life sentence for the attempted murder of another woman. When one of her boots was found in woodland detectives searched the area, but no body was recovered.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Jesse Capen, a 35-year-old hotel worker from Denver, who disappeared in December 2009 after setting out on a month-long trek to find the Lost Dutchman's gold mine in the remote Superstition Mountains of Arizona. His remains were finally found wedged in an inaccessible crevasse four years later.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Meghan is angry with her maid of honour for stealing the limelight, while LaToya's choice of dress causes a wardrobe malfunction for her bridesmaid.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride would like an azalea green dress, but her sister has different ideas. Plus, a woman tries to convince her sibling to wear a dress for the first time in 15 years.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Sibling rivalry gets in the way of a dress selection, and a soon-to-be-married woman disagrees with her brother over gown styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a dress for a bossy bridesmaid, while Summer wants a gown that is over her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a gown for a group of bridesmaids who hate the wedding's colour scheme, while Leslie faces a mutiny when she struggles to pick a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride searching for modest bridesmaid dresses falls in love with a revealing gown that reduces her mother to tears.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a rusty drill press, a post-war chair and some wooden blocks from being discarded in Walsall, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals for which owners Lynette and David want big money. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Documentary following eight people as they try to lose weight with the help of gastric bypass surgery. Zsalynn has become secluded in her home and has to rely on other people to take care of her. She wants to do what 'normal-sized' mothers can do and is at breaking point. Can the surgery help?.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A psychological profile of Sheila LaBarre, who lured men to her New Hampshire farm and was convicted of killing Kenneth Countie and Michael DeLoge.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The case of Sabrina Kouider, the ex-girlfriend of Boyzone founder Mark Walton who was jailed for life for the murder of a French nanny.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In the 1980s and '90s, there were around 200 murders and attacks on sex workers across the Midlands. Stafford man Alun Kyte was later found to be responsible.
